name: Hoin Riverbank
description: The river is surrounded on both sides by thick foliage. The only reasonable way to continue is by raft.

name: Hoin River
description: Floating along the river you can see all sorts of fish swimming past the clear water.

name: Plantrain Plains
description: The foliage along the banks of the river grow thin as you pass by an open field, full of small farm plots. A number of old buildings stand along their edge.

name: Sun's Harbor
description: A few buildings sit just off the river's edge. A large graveyard makes up the remainder of the open land not covered by trees.

buildings.name: Sun's Harbor Supplies
buildings.description: The small supply store has a number of useful items for an adventurer.

buildings.name: Tammy's Tannery
buildings.description: You enter the tannery and are greeted by Tammy. There are a few places to tan hides. You can also buy a few different meat products here.

name: Guttermouth
description: You begin to reach signs of civilization. Down at the river's mouth you can see a large city. A number of houses surround the main building here, which has the word 'Woodworks' carved on the front of it.

buildings.name: Woodworker's Association
buildings.description: The building is long and brightly lit. The chandeliers are the only things in the building not made entirely out of wood. There is a shop to buy wood working materials on the far end.

name: Ricechild
description: You reach a bustling city at the mouth of the river. There are a few interesting shops here.

buildings.name: Brian's Bakery
buildings.description: A skinny, orange-haired man stands behind the counter. He addresses you as plural even though you're the only one in the shop.

buildings.name: Ricechild Smithy
buildings.description: The smithy here is quite large. It can handle a good number of stronger metals, but the heat is too much for the weakest metals.

buildings.name: Hunter's Guild
buildings.description: A handful of guild members are sitting around tables, telling stories and drinking. The one corner of the guild serves as a shop that sells even to non-members. The far wall is covered with a very detailed map.
